Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech, a fundamental value in Australian society.
There is concern over who decides what constitutes misinformation, disinformation, and hate speech.
The Australian Communications and Media Authority may not be capable of objectively determining truth.
Personal experience of perceived unjust suppression of speech on social media raises concerns about similar actions under the new legislation.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is a cornerstone value of Australian society which has given us much of what we enjoy in this country today.
My question is who decides what is misinformation, disinformation and hate speech?

To introduce the Combating Misinformation and Disinformation Bill proposed by the Albanese government injects a dangerous subjective element into deciding which speech is allowed and which speech should be suppressed.
